org.phoenixbioinformatics.http

Class RequestFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.phoenixbioinformatics.http.RequestFactory

  • public class RequestFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    A factory method class that generates an HTTP URI request of an appropriate type given a servlet request, rewritten to proxy to the target server; supports only the following methods:
    • GET
    • POST
    • PUT
    • DELETE
    • OPTIONS
    Author:
    Robert J. Muller

      • getMethodByString

        public static RequestFactory.HttpMethod getMethodByString(java.lang.String methodString)
                                                   throws UnsupportedHttpMethodException
        Returns the enum representation of a HttpMethod for a given string
        Parameters:
        methodString - String representation of a HttpMethod
        Returns:
        Enum representation of a HttpMethod
        Throws:

      • getUriRequest

        public static org.apache.http.client.methods.HttpUriRequest getUriRequest(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest servletRequest,
                                                          java.lang.String partnerHostUri)
                                                                   throws UnsupportedHttpMethodException,
                                                                          java.io.IOException
        Generate a rewritten HTTP URI request object based on the content of a servlet request. The method handles all supported HTTP request methods.
        Parameters:
        servletRequest - the HTTP servlet request containing the URI to proxy
        partnerHostUri - the scheme and authority for the target partner host
        Returns:
        the rewritten URI to proxy
        Throws:
        UnsupportedHttpMethodException - when the method in the servlet request is not a supported method (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, OPTIONS)
        java.io.IOException - when the URI request can't be initialized
